This Statement of Work (“SoW”) is made as of the date of last signature hereto by and between Hewlett Packard Enterprise (“HPE”) and the Client and identifies the professional Services (“Services”) HPE will perform for the Client. 

This SoW is governed by the HPE and Terms for Professional Services. (Attachment “A”). Handwritten or typewritten text (other than information specifically called for in the spaces provided) that purports to modify or supplement the  printed text of this SoW shall have no effect and shall not add to or vary the terms of this SoW.

The Services will conduct the following:

  • Outline of scope and deliverables

sowTemplateFields.fieldDefaultValue: The Work Packages are identified by the following components:  Prerequisites – Lists any prerequisites that must be completed prior to commencement of this Work Package.   Assumptions – Describes any specific assumptions to the Work Package in addition to general assumptions as listed in section 5.   Services – Describes the activities to be undertaken as part of this Work Package.   Deliverables – Lists all Deliverables to be provided by HPE as part of this Work Package.   Acceptance criteria – Details the criteria under which customer will accept completion of this Work Package.    Customer responsibilities – Lists specific responsibilities to be met by customer as part of this Work Package in addition to general responsibilities as listed in section 5. This is HPE’s best estimation of customer staff’s participation in the Project based on our past experience and similar engagements with other Clients.  Exclusions – Lists specific exclusions to the Work Package.
sowTemplateFields.fieldHtmlDefaultValue:
The Work Packages are identified by the following components:

Prerequisites – Lists any prerequisites that must be completed prior to commencement of this Work Package. 

Assumptions – Describes any specific assumptions to the Work Package in addition to general assumptions as listed in section 5. 

Services – Describes the activities to be undertaken as part of this Work Package. 

Deliverables – Lists all Deliverables to be provided by HPE as part of this Work Package. 

Acceptance criteria – Details the criteria under which customer will accept completion of this Work Package.

Customer responsibilities – Lists specific responsibilities to be met by customer as part of this Work Package in addition to general responsibilities as listed in section 5. This is HPE’s best estimation of customer staff’s participation in the Project based on our past experience and similar engagements with other Clients.

Exclusions – Lists specific exclusions to the Work Package.

sowTemplateFields.fieldDefaultValue:
4.1.1.	Risk and Issue Management
All risks and issues identified during the Project will be recorded on a risk and issue register based on the standard HPE risk management format. Risks and issues pass through a number of lifecycle stages and as part of Project control, will be updated and reviewed on a weekly basis. Where a risk or issue is ranked as 1 – very high or 2 – high, these will appear on the HPE Project Managers weekly summary report and will be highlighted at the next Steering Committee.
4.1.2.	Change Process
Either HPE or Client may initiate a Change, in writing, to the Project. A Change initiation form will be provided by HPE to be used for this purpose. The Change will be evaluated, and any Project impact will be identified. If the evaluation of a Change request submitted by Client takes more than four (4) hours to complete, the cost of evaluation may be charged to Client and any schedule slippage as a result of performing the evaluation will be documented as a formal Change to the schedule. The price, scope, and schedule impact, if any, will be analyzed and documented. The Change impact will then be processed for Client authorization or closure. The Change request form will include a description of the Change, reason for the Change, and initiator of the Change as well as impact to scope, price, quality, schedule, resources, and risks. All Changes must be mutually agreed by the Parties in writing. Once approved, Changes to the initial Project will be implemented as described. 
If HPE and Client are unable to resolve disposition of a Change, the scope will remain as defined in this document.
sowTemplateFields.fieldHtmlDefaultValue:
Risk and Issue Management

All risks and issues identified during the Project will be recorded on a risk and issue register based on the standard HPE risk management format. Risks and issues pass through a number of lifecycle stages and as part of Project control, will be updated and reviewed on a weekly basis. Where a risk or issue is ranked as 1 – very high or 2 – high, these will appear on the HPE Project Managers weekly summary report and will be highlighted at the next Steering Committee.

Change Process

Either HPE or Client may initiate a Change, in writing, to the Project. A Change initiation form will be provided by HPE to be used for this purpose. The Change will be evaluated, and any Project impact will be identified. If the evaluation of a Change request submitted by Client takes more than four (4) hours to complete, the cost of evaluation may be charged to Client and any schedule slippage as a result of performing the evaluation will be documented as a formal Change to the schedule. The price, scope, and schedule impact, if any, will be analyzed and documented. The Change impact will then be processed for Client authorization or closure. The Change request form will include a description of the Change, reason for the Change, and initiator of the Change as well as impact to scope, price, quality, schedule, resources, and risks. All Changes must be mutually agreed by the Parties in writing. Once approved, Changes to the initial Project will be implemented as described.

If HPE and Client are unable to resolve disposition of a Change, the scope will remain as defined in this document.

sowTemplateFields.fieldDefaultValue: Each Work Package shall be accepted by Client upon Acceptance of the Work Package’s Deliverables. If a Work Package doesn’t contain any Deliverables then the Services under the Work Package are deemed accepted upon delivery.  4.2.1. Document Review Process and Acceptance  If HPE provides documentation as part of the Project, each document deliverable will initially be developed in draft form. The HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant and Client’s Project Manager may schedule working sessions, inclusive of HPE and/or Client personnel, to refine the draft document as it is written.  When the draft document is complete, the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant will submit the initial release document to Client Project Manager for review. Client Project Manager will be responsible for distributing copies of the initial release document for internal review. Client Project Manager is responsible for consolidating Client’s comments and for providing a clearly marked version of the draft document to HPE’s Project Manager/Lead Consultant. Client’s Project Manager will have 10 Working Days to review and return the consolidated comments to the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant, unless otherwise agreed to by the parties. If no revisions are received within the timeframe, the document will be considered accepted. HPE will review and evaluate Client comments and respond to them in writing within 10 working days. Client comments and HPE’s recommendations will be discussed and integrated within 10 Working Days into a final version and delivered to Client’s Project Manager.   Delivery of the final version of a document will constitute Client’s Acceptance of the document deliverable.   4.2.2. Acceptance of Non-Document Deliverables  Client and HPE shall, in relation to each non-document deliverable, develop and agree a set of Acceptance Tests, as relevant, and Acceptance Criteria.   Non-document Deliverables are deemed accepted upon successful execution of the Acceptance Tests. In the absence of any Acceptance Tests being agreed, then Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred upon performance of the Services by HPE. The Acceptance process will apply only to the Deliverables specified, and shall not apply to other products or Services to be provided by HPE.   Document Deliverables will be deemed accepted upon delivery of the final version according to procedure documented above.  If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverables meet the Acceptance Criteria, then Client shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.  If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverable fails to meet the Acceptance Criteria then Client may elect to  ? Accept the Deliverable with non-conformances on an AS IS basis and shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.  ? Notify HPE in writing within 10 Working Days after the Acceptance Tests have been completed, of the details of how the Deliverable is considered to fail meeting the Acceptance Criteria. HPE shall, within a reasonable time period after receipt of Client’s notification correct non-conformances attributable to HPE, so that the Deliverable (as modified) meets the Acceptance Criteria and resubmit the Deliverable (as modified) to a repeat of the Acceptance Tests.  Where the Deliverable (as modified) does not pass the repeated Acceptance Tests conducted, Client may elect to:  ? Agree a new date for carrying out further Acceptance Tests in respect of the relevant Deliverables. If the Deliverable fails such further tests then Client shall be entitled to request a repeat test or  ? Accept the Deliverable:  ? Subject to agreeing an amendment to the relevant Acceptance Criteria or  ? On an AS IS basis, subject to a reasonable adjustment of the Charges, to be agreed by the parties within a reasonable time period after such election. Such adjustment shall take into account all the relevant circumstances or  ? Reject the Deliverable and return the affected Deliverable and all copies of the associated documentation to HPE.  Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred on whichever is the earliest of the:  ? Written confirmation by Client confirming that the Deliverable is accepted  ? Expiry of 10 Working Days after the completion of the relevant Acceptance Tests, and Client does not notify HPE in that time of any objectively verifiable non-compliance with the relevant Acceptance Criteria  ? Use of the Deliverable by Client, in any manner, including putting the Deliverable into productive use or using the Deliverable in production  After Acceptance of a Deliverable, the Change Process procedure will apply to request any modifications.
sowTemplateFields.fieldHtmlDefaultValue:
Each Work Package shall be accepted by Client upon Acceptance of the Work Package’s Deliverables. If a Work Package doesn’t contain any Deliverables then the Services under the Work Package are deemed accepted upon delivery.

Document Review Process and Acceptance

If HPE provides documentation as part of the Project, each document deliverable will initially be developed in draft form. The HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant and Client’s Project Manager may schedule working sessions, inclusive of HPE and/or Client personnel, to refine the draft document as it is written.

When the draft document is complete, the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant will submit the initial release document to Client Project Manager for review. Client Project Manager will be responsible for distributing copies of the initial release document for internal review. Client Project Manager is responsible for consolidating Client’s comments and for providing a clearly marked version of the draft document to HPE’s Project Manager/Lead Consultant. Client’s Project Manager will have 10 Working Days to review and return the consolidated comments to the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant, unless otherwise agreed to by the parties. If no revisions are received within the timeframe, the document will be considered accepted. HPE will review and evaluate Client comments and respond to them in writing within 10 working days. Client comments and HPE’s recommendations will be discussed and integrated within 10 Working Days into a final version and delivered to Client’s Project Manager.

Delivery of the final version of a document will constitute Client’s Acceptance of the document deliverable.

Acceptance of Non-Document Deliverables

Client and HPE shall, in relation to each non-document deliverable, develop and agree a set of Acceptance Tests, as relevant, and Acceptance Criteria.

Non-document Deliverables are deemed accepted upon successful execution of the Acceptance Tests. In the absence of any Acceptance Tests being agreed, then Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred upon performance of the Services by HPE. The Acceptance process will apply only to the Deliverables specified, and shall not apply to other products or Services to be provided by HPE.

Document Deliverables will be deemed accepted upon delivery of the final version according to procedure documented above.

If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverables meet the Acceptance Criteria, then Client shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.

If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverable fails to meet the Acceptance Criteria then Client may elect to

  • Accept the Deliverable with non-conformances on an AS IS basis and shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.
  • Notify HPE in writing within 10 Working Days after the Acceptance Tests have been completed, of the details of how the Deliverable is considered to fail meeting the Acceptance Criteria. HPE shall, within a reasonable time period after receipt of Client’s notification correct non-conformances attributable to HPE, so that the Deliverable (as modified) meets the Acceptance Criteria and resubmit the Deliverable (as modified) to a repeat of the Acceptance Tests.

Where the Deliverable (as modified) does not pass the repeated Acceptance Tests conducted, Client may elect to:

  • Agree a new date for carrying out further Acceptance Tests in respect of the relevant Deliverables. If the Deliverable fails such further tests then Client shall be entitled to request a repeat test or
  • Accept the Deliverable:
    • Subject to agreeing an amendment to the relevant Acceptance Criteria or
    • On an AS IS basis, subject to a reasonable adjustment of the Charges, to be agreed by the parties within a reasonable time period after such election. Such adjustment shall take into account all the relevant circumstances or
  • Reject the Deliverable and return the affected Deliverable and all copies of the associated documentation to HPE.

Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred on whichever is the earliest of the:

  • Written confirmation by Client confirming that the Deliverable is accepted
  • Expiry of 10 Working Days after the completion of the relevant Acceptance Tests, and Client does not notify HPE in that time of any objectively verifiable non-compliance with the relevant Acceptance Criteria
  • Use of the Deliverable by Client, in any manner, including putting the Deliverable into productive use or using the Deliverable in production

After Acceptance of a Deliverable, the Change Process procedure will apply to request any modifications.

sowTemplateFields.fieldDefaultValue: HPE may periodically conduct a Quality and Risk Assessment review at Client’s site(s) focusing on Project Management and/or technical architecture and execution. Additional review of Project planning and controls may also be performed. To help provide effective quality and risk review, Client agrees to participate in interviews of the Project Executive Sponsor and key Client management staff, at least once during the duration of this SoW.

In addition to the specific Assumptions defined in the Work Packages of this SoW, the following general Assumptions apply:
1.	Good faith cooperation. HPE and Client acknowledge that successful completion of this Project will require full and mutual good faith cooperation. Where agreement, approval, Acceptance, consent or similar action by either party is required by any provision of this SoW, such action will not be unreasonably delayed or withheld. Client agrees that to the extent its failure to meet its responsibilities results in a failure or delay by HPE in performing its obligations under this SoW, HPE will not be liable for such failure or delay.
2.	Services under this SoW will be performed during business hours on Working Days. If Client requests and subsequently authorizes a Change for delivery outside business hours, those hours are subject to availability of HPE personnel, and an uplift as specified in the pricing section will apply.
3.	The on-site/off-site schedule of the HPE team is based on optimal delivery efficiency and may include delivery of Services by remote resources in HPE’s Global Competency Centers. If Client requires HPE to work more or only on-site this may impact pricing and/or travel costs.
4.	Reference to named individuals in this SoW does not guarantee these individuals will be available for the performance of the Services. HPE will assign its service delivery personnel only after the Order (see hereafter) for the Service under this SoW based on availability and required skills level.
5.	Documentation created during this engagement is in English and produced in Word, PowerPoint or PDF format. The engagement planning software used for this engagement will be Microsoft Project.
6.	Any Services not explicitly documented in this SoW are considered outside the scope.
7.	In addition to the specific Client responsibilities outlined in section 3 of this SoW, Client shall do/provide the following:
a.	Assign managers and other personnel, as appropriate, to work with HPE throughout the Project. Provide to HPE a list of Project Members, Roles and Responsibilities. It is expected that Client will engage and participate in the Work Packages. Project performance is predicated on Client’s staff.
b.	Provide staff support which will include: 
	Executive sponsor
	Key stakeholders/SMEs and Technical resources
	Access to systems for HPE to conduct discovery including access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
Note:   staff may play multiple roles or have access to the people in the organization that can fulfil the roles in terms of answering questions and quickly escalating decisions.
c.	Assume responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, and the timely provision of all information provided by Client. If information is incomplete or incorrect, any delay and anything required to correct problems created by the use of such incomplete or inaccurate information will be treated as a Client requested Change Request to the SoW and subject to the Change Process.
d.	Purchase or provide as per agreed time schedule all hardware, software, licenses, staff, maintenance contracts, and test environments necessary for HPE to provide the Services as documented in this SoW.
e.	Provide appropriate access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
f.	Complete tasks as agreed
8.	During the course of providing the Services, HPE may be required to install copies of software products. As part of the installation process, HPE may be asked to accept license terms in electronic format or contained within the software documentation. Client will ensure these license terms are reviewed upfront and authorizes HPE to accept these license terms on Client’s behalf.
9.	Provide HPE personnel access to Client’s building facilities, computer room facilities, systems, passwords, etc., as needed, during normal business hours as well as after hours, if needed.
10.	Provide a suitable work area commensurate with the number of on-site HPE consultants. The work area will include desks, chairs, and telephones, and internet/HPE network access such as through a Virtual Private Network (VPN) with sufficient capacity to perform the Services.
11.	Perform any backups needed before changes are made and perform backup of the target systems and work implemented by HPE.
12.	HPE staff will use their own PCs / machines and will be given access to   network (with suitable connectivity)
13.	The Work Schedule and the delivery governance will be based directly on this SOW. HPE Engagement Lead will manage only those activities assigned to HPE defined in this SOW.
14.	The governance of the delivery of this SOW will be determined by mutual agreement of HPE and the   Manager at the commencement of the delivery.
15.	The internal operation of the agreed governance processes will be carried out by the   Manager within the   environment. 
16.	The HPE engagement lead will call Project related meetings, prepare HPE briefing materials, meeting agendas and the   Manager will provide   related materials and resources as input to such meetings where required. 
17.	The governance structure adopted may be specific to this SOW or may form part of a wider structure within the   ,and HPE.
sowTemplateFields.fieldHtmlDefaultValue:
In addition to the specific Assumptions defined in the Work Packages of this SoW, the following general Assumptions apply:

  1. Good faith cooperation. HPE and Client acknowledge that successful completion of this Project will require full and mutual good faith cooperation. Where agreement, approval, Acceptance, consent or similar action by either party is required by any provision of this SoW, such action will not be unreasonably delayed or withheld. Client agrees that to the extent its failure to meet its responsibilities results in a failure or delay by HPE in performing its obligations under this SoW, HPE will not be liable for such failure or delay.
  2. Services under this SoW will be performed during business hours on Working Days. If Client requests and subsequently authorizes a Change for delivery outside business hours, those hours are subject to availability of HPE personnel, and an uplift as specified in the pricing section will apply.
  3. The on-site/off-site schedule of the HPE team is based on optimal delivery efficiency and may include delivery of Services by remote resources in HPE’s Global Competency Centers. If Client requires HPE to work more or only on-site this may impact pricing and/or travel costs.
  4. Reference to named individuals in this SoW does not guarantee these individuals will be available for the performance of the Services. HPE will assign its service delivery personnel only after the Order (see hereafter) for the Service under this SoW based on availability and required skills level.
  5. Documentation created during this engagement is in English and produced in Word, PowerPoint or PDF format. The engagement planning software used for this engagement will be Microsoft Project.
  6. Any Services not explicitly documented in this SoW are considered outside the scope.
  7. In addition to the specific Client responsibilities outlined in section 3 of this SoW, Client shall do/provide the following:
    1. Assign managers and other personnel, as appropriate, to work with HPE throughout the Project. Provide to HPE a list of Project Members, Roles and Responsibilities. It is expected that Client will engage and participate in the Work Packages. Project performance is predicated on Client’s staff.
    2. Provide staff support which will include:
      • Executive sponsor
      • Key stakeholders/SMEs and Technical resources
      • Access to systems for HPE to conduct discovery including access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
      Note: staff may play multiple roles or have access to the people in the organization that can fulfil the roles in terms of answering questions and quickly escalating decisions.
    3. Assume responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, and the timely provision of all information provided by Client. If information is incomplete or incorrect, any delay and anything required to correct problems created by the use of such incomplete or inaccurate information will be treated as a Client requested Change Request to the SoW and subject to the Change Process.
    4. Purchase or provide as per agreed time schedule all hardware, software, licenses, staff, maintenance contracts, and test environments necessary for HPE to provide the Services as documented in this SoW.
    5. Provide appropriate access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
    6. Complete tasks as agreed
  8. During the course of providing the Services, HPE may be required to install copies of software products. As part of the installation process, HPE may be asked to accept license terms in electronic format or contained within the software documentation. Client will ensure these license terms are reviewed upfront and authorizes HPE to accept these license terms on Client’s behalf.
  9. Provide HPE personnel access to Client’s building facilities, computer room facilities, systems, passwords, etc., as needed, during normal business hours as well as after hours, if needed.
  10. Provide a suitable work area commensurate with the number of on-site HPE consultants. The work area will include desks, chairs, and telephones, and internet/HPE network access such as through a Virtual Private Network (VPN) with sufficient capacity to perform the Services.
  11. Perform any backups needed before changes are made and perform backup of the target systems and work implemented by HPE.
  12. HPE staff will use their own PCs / machines and will be given access to network (with suitable connectivity)
  13. The Work Schedule and the delivery governance will be based directly on this SOW. HPE Engagement Lead will manage only those activities assigned to HPE defined in this SOW.
  14. The governance of the delivery of this SOW will be determined by mutual agreement of HPE and the Manager at the commencement of the delivery.
  15. The internal operation of the agreed governance processes will be carried out by the Manager within the environment.
  16. The HPE engagement lead will call Project related meetings, prepare HPE briefing materials, meeting agendas and the Manager will provide related materials and resources as input to such meetings where required.
  17. The governance structure adopted may be specific to this SOW or may form part of a wider structure within the ,and HPE.

tableValue.value: Acceptance Criteria
A condition or characteristic that must be present within a Deliverable during an Acceptance Test in order for the Deliverable to be accepted.
Assumption
Underlying fact that is taken to be true and relied upon by the parties when pricing and scoping this SoW.
Change

Any modification or other change in the nature, level and/or extent of the Services, or any change to the other terms of this SoW, or any change in the means or manner in which the Services are provided.
Charges
Charges for the provision of the Services set out in section 7 of this SoW.
Deliverable

Tangible work product resulting from HPE’s performance of the Services. The Deliverables to be provided by HPE as specified in this SoW and shall not apply to third party products provided by HPE, which may be used in conjunction with the Services and/or Deliverables.
Engagement Lead
The role responsible for the delivery of the Project and its constituent Work Packages, Services, Deliverables and Responsibilities from a HPE or Client perspective, as set out in this SoW.
Party / Parties
Client and HPE shall collectively be referred to in the Contract as the “Parties” and singularly as a “Party”.
Project
HPE’s Project containing the Services as set out in this SoW.
Project Schedule
The Project schedule to which the Services shall be delivered in accordance with this SoW.
Services
The Services to be provided by HPE as set out in section 2 of this SoW.
Work Package
The work to be undertaken by the parties as set out in section 2.1 of this SoW.

sowTemplateField.fieldDefaultValue:
4.1.1.	Risk and Issue Management
All risks and issues identified during the Project will be recorded on a risk and issue register based on the standard HPE risk management format. Risks and issues pass through a number of lifecycle stages and as part of Project control, will be updated and reviewed on a weekly basis. Where a risk or issue is ranked as 1 – very high or 2 – high, these will appear on the HPE Project Managers weekly summary report and will be highlighted at the next Steering Committee.
4.1.2.	Change Process
Either HPE or Client may initiate a Change, in writing, to the Project. A Change initiation form will be provided by HPE to be used for this purpose. The Change will be evaluated, and any Project impact will be identified. If the evaluation of a Change request submitted by Client takes more than four (4) hours to complete, the cost of evaluation may be charged to Client and any schedule slippage as a result of performing the evaluation will be documented as a formal Change to the schedule. The price, scope, and schedule impact, if any, will be analyzed and documented. The Change impact will then be processed for Client authorization or closure. The Change request form will include a description of the Change, reason for the Change, and initiator of the Change as well as impact to scope, price, quality, schedule, resources, and risks. All Changes must be mutually agreed by the Parties in writing. Once approved, Changes to the initial Project will be implemented as described. 
If HPE and Client are unable to resolve disposition of a Change, the scope will remain as defined in this document.

sowTemplateField.fieldDefaultValue: Each Work Package shall be accepted by Client upon Acceptance of the Work Package’s Deliverables. If a Work Package doesn’t contain any Deliverables then the Services under the Work Package are deemed accepted upon delivery.  4.2.1. Document Review Process and Acceptance  If HPE provides documentation as part of the Project, each document deliverable will initially be developed in draft form. The HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant and Client’s Project Manager may schedule working sessions, inclusive of HPE and/or Client personnel, to refine the draft document as it is written.  When the draft document is complete, the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant will submit the initial release document to Client Project Manager for review. Client Project Manager will be responsible for distributing copies of the initial release document for internal review. Client Project Manager is responsible for consolidating Client’s comments and for providing a clearly marked version of the draft document to HPE’s Project Manager/Lead Consultant. Client’s Project Manager will have 10 Working Days to review and return the consolidated comments to the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant, unless otherwise agreed to by the parties. If no revisions are received within the timeframe, the document will be considered accepted. HPE will review and evaluate Client comments and respond to them in writing within 10 working days. Client comments and HPE’s recommendations will be discussed and integrated within 10 Working Days into a final version and delivered to Client’s Project Manager.   Delivery of the final version of a document will constitute Client’s Acceptance of the document deliverable.   4.2.2. Acceptance of Non-Document Deliverables  Client and HPE shall, in relation to each non-document deliverable, develop and agree a set of Acceptance Tests, as relevant, and Acceptance Criteria.   Non-document Deliverables are deemed accepted upon successful execution of the Acceptance Tests. In the absence of any Acceptance Tests being agreed, then Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred upon performance of the Services by HPE. The Acceptance process will apply only to the Deliverables specified, and shall not apply to other products or Services to be provided by HPE.   Document Deliverables will be deemed accepted upon delivery of the final version according to procedure documented above.  If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverables meet the Acceptance Criteria, then Client shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.  If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverable fails to meet the Acceptance Criteria then Client may elect to  ? Accept the Deliverable with non-conformances on an AS IS basis and shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.  ? Notify HPE in writing within 10 Working Days after the Acceptance Tests have been completed, of the details of how the Deliverable is considered to fail meeting the Acceptance Criteria. HPE shall, within a reasonable time period after receipt of Client’s notification correct non-conformances attributable to HPE, so that the Deliverable (as modified) meets the Acceptance Criteria and resubmit the Deliverable (as modified) to a repeat of the Acceptance Tests.  Where the Deliverable (as modified) does not pass the repeated Acceptance Tests conducted, Client may elect to:  ? Agree a new date for carrying out further Acceptance Tests in respect of the relevant Deliverables. If the Deliverable fails such further tests then Client shall be entitled to request a repeat test or  ? Accept the Deliverable:  ? Subject to agreeing an amendment to the relevant Acceptance Criteria or  ? On an AS IS basis, subject to a reasonable adjustment of the Charges, to be agreed by the parties within a reasonable time period after such election. Such adjustment shall take into account all the relevant circumstances or  ? Reject the Deliverable and return the affected Deliverable and all copies of the associated documentation to HPE. sowTemplateField.fieldHtmlDefaultValue:
Each Work Package shall be accepted by Client upon Acceptance of the Work Package’s Deliverables. If a Work Package doesn’t contain any Deliverables then the Services under the Work Package are deemed accepted upon delivery.

Document Review Process and Acceptance

If HPE provides documentation as part of the Project, each document deliverable will initially be developed in draft form. The HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant and Client’s Project Manager may schedule working sessions, inclusive of HPE and/or Client personnel, to refine the draft document as it is written.

When the draft document is complete, the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant will submit the initial release document to Client Project Manager for review. Client Project Manager will be responsible for distributing copies of the initial release document for internal review. Client Project Manager is responsible for consolidating Client’s comments and for providing a clearly marked version of the draft document to HPE’s Project Manager/Lead Consultant. Client’s Project Manager will have 10 Working Days to review and return the consolidated comments to the HPE Project Manager/Lead Consultant, unless otherwise agreed to by the parties. If no revisions are received within the timeframe, the document will be considered accepted. HPE will review and evaluate Client comments and respond to them in writing within 10 working days. Client comments and HPE’s recommendations will be discussed and integrated within 10 Working Days into a final version and delivered to Client’s Project Manager.

Delivery of the final version of a document will constitute Client’s Acceptance of the document deliverable.

Acceptance of Non-Document Deliverables

Client and HPE shall, in relation to each non-document deliverable, develop and agree a set of Acceptance Tests, as relevant, and Acceptance Criteria.

Non-document Deliverables are deemed accepted upon successful execution of the Acceptance Tests. In the absence of any Acceptance Tests being agreed, then Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred upon performance of the Services by HPE. The Acceptance process will apply only to the Deliverables specified, and shall not apply to other products or Services to be provided by HPE.

Document Deliverables will be deemed accepted upon delivery of the final version according to procedure documented above.

If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverables meet the Acceptance Criteria, then Client shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.

If the Acceptance Tests demonstrate that the Deliverable fails to meet the Acceptance Criteria then Client may elect to

  • Accept the Deliverable with non-conformances on an AS IS basis and shall provide written notification to HPE that Client accepts the Deliverable and Acceptance is thereby achieved.
  • Notify HPE in writing within 10 Working Days after the Acceptance Tests have been completed, of the details of how the Deliverable is considered to fail meeting the Acceptance Criteria. HPE shall, within a reasonable time period after receipt of Client’s notification correct non-conformances attributable to HPE, so that the Deliverable (as modified) meets the Acceptance Criteria and resubmit the Deliverable (as modified) to a repeat of the Acceptance Tests.

Where the Deliverable (as modified) does not pass the repeated Acceptance Tests conducted, Client may elect to:

  • Agree a new date for carrying out further Acceptance Tests in respect of the relevant Deliverables. If the Deliverable fails such further tests then Client shall be entitled to request a repeat test or
  • Accept the Deliverable:
    • Subject to agreeing an amendment to the relevant Acceptance Criteria or
    • On an AS IS basis, subject to a reasonable adjustment of the Charges, to be agreed by the parties within a reasonable time period after such election. Such adjustment shall take into account all the relevant circumstances or
  • Reject the Deliverable and return the affected Deliverable and all copies of the associated documentation to HPE.

Acceptance shall be deemed to have occurred on whichever is the earliest of the:

  • Written confirmation by Client confirming that the Deliverable is accepted
  • Expiry of 10 Working Days after the completion of the relevant Acceptance Tests, and Client does not notify HPE in that time of any objectively verifiable non-compliance with the relevant Acceptance Criteria
  • Use of the Deliverable by Client, in any manner, including putting the Deliverable into productive use or using the Deliverable in production

After Acceptance of a Deliverable, the Change Process procedure will apply to request any modifications.

sowTemplateField.fieldDefaultValue:
In addition to the specific Assumptions defined in the Work Packages of this SoW, the following general Assumptions apply:
1.	Good faith cooperation. HPE and Client acknowledge that successful completion of this Project will require full and mutual good faith cooperation. Where agreement, approval, Acceptance, consent or similar action by either party is required by any provision of this SoW, such action will not be unreasonably delayed or withheld. Client agrees that to the extent its failure to meet its responsibilities results in a failure or delay by HPE in performing its obligations under this SoW, HPE will not be liable for such failure or delay.
2.	Services under this SoW will be performed during business hours on Working Days. If Client requests and subsequently authorizes a Change for delivery outside business hours, those hours are subject to availability of HPE personnel, and an uplift as specified in the pricing section will apply.
3.	The on-site/off-site schedule of the HPE team is based on optimal delivery efficiency and may include delivery of Services by remote resources in HPE’s Global Competency Centers. If Client requires HPE to work more or only on-site this may impact pricing and/or travel costs.
4.	Reference to named individuals in this SoW does not guarantee these individuals will be available for the performance of the Services. HPE will assign its service delivery personnel only after the Order (see hereafter) for the Service under this SoW based on availability and required skills level.
5.	Documentation created during this engagement is in English and produced in Word, PowerPoint or PDF format. The engagement planning software used for this engagement will be Microsoft Project.
6.	Any Services not explicitly documented in this SoW are considered outside the scope.
7.	In addition to the specific Client responsibilities outlined in section 3 of this SoW, Client shall do/provide the following:
a.	Assign managers and other personnel, as appropriate, to work with HPE throughout the Project. Provide to HPE a list of Project Members, Roles and Responsibilities. It is expected that Client will engage and participate in the Work Packages. Project performance is predicated on Client’s staff.
b.	Provide staff support which will include: 
	Executive sponsor
	Key stakeholders/SMEs and Technical resources
	Access to systems for HPE to conduct discovery including access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
Note:   staff may play multiple roles or have access to the people in the organization that can fulfil the roles in terms of answering questions and quickly escalating decisions.
c.	Assume responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, and the timely provision of all information provided by Client. If information is incomplete or incorrect, any delay and anything required to correct problems created by the use of such incomplete or inaccurate information will be treated as a Client requested Change Request to the SoW and subject to the Change Process.
d.	Purchase or provide as per agreed time schedule all hardware, software, licenses, staff, maintenance contracts, and test environments necessary for HPE to provide the Services as documented in this SoW.
e.	Provide appropriate access for HPE’s discovery tool to run appropriately in one working day
f.	Complete tasks as agreed
8.	During the course of providing the Services, HPE may be required to install copies of software products. As part of the installation process, HPE may be asked to accept license terms in electronic format or contained within the software documentation. Client will ensure these license terms are reviewed upfront and authorizes HPE to accept these license terms on Client’s behalf.
9.	Provide HPE personnel access to Client’s building facilities, computer room facilities, systems, passwords, etc., as needed, during normal business hours as well as after hours, if needed.
10.	Provide a suitable work area commensurate with the number of on-site HPE consultants. The work area will include desks, chairs, and telephones, and internet/HPE network access such as through a Virtual Private Network (VPN) with sufficient capacity to perform the Services.
11.	Perform any backups needed before changes are made and perform backup of the target systems and work implemented by HPE.
12.	HPE staff will use their own PCs / machines and will be given access to   network (with suitable connectivity)
13.	The Work Schedule and the delivery governance will be based directly on this SOW. HPE Engagement Lead will manage only those activities assigned to HPE defined in this SOW.
14.	The governance of the delivery of this SOW will be determined by mutual agreement of HPE and the   Manager at the commencement of the delivery.
15.	The internal operation of the agreed governance processes will be carried out by the   Manager within the   environment. 
16.	The HPE engagement lead will call Project related meetings, prepare HPE briefing materials, meeting agendas and the   Manager will provide   related materials and resources as input to such meetings where required. 
17.	The governance structure adopted may be specific to this SOW or may form part of a wider structure within the   ,and HPE.
